name: recomputation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act or process of calculating an answer or amount for a second, third, etc. time: The case was remanded to the lower court for a recomputation of damages. They claimed that their taxes were subject to re-computation based on the "adjusted" price of their purchases.
More examplesFewer examplesA 20% down payment is required on new mortgages, and a recomputation of the principal amount on existing mortgages.The system uses recomputation rather than stack-copying.The amount of accrued benefit resulting from such recomputation is calculated.
